question: Which country's UNESCO World Heritage Site is "Chateau de Chenonceau"?
explanation: Chateau de Chenonceau is a symbol of the architectural blossoming of the Renaissance, which is a part of the Loire Valley, a UNESCO World Heritage Site of France. Chateau is a French word for a manor house or a country house of nobility. It is located spanning River Cher in the Loire Valley of France. It is an architectural mix of late Gothic and early Renaissance. It is an important tourist attraction that is open to the public.
